channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CAMEL-9130] "need to add the dependency of jedis as redis client lib"
item.description: When I tried to use spring-redis component, it turned out it needed a dependency on Jedis, which is explained in the pom of the component. I was wondering if there's any reason for the dependency not being used (looking for a more performant redis client for example) ? Otherwise, Jedis 2.6.3 should be used as 2.7.X didn't seem to work.
item.summary: "need to add the dependency of jedis as redis client lib"

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: You are welcome to work on a patch to add that dependency to the pom

GitHub user SyBen opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/camel/pull/611

CAMEL-9130 : added dependency to Jedis client

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/SyBen/camel patch-1

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/camel/pull/611.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #611

commit 6d792905196323969db6cdacb298ef672ca0d05f
Author: SyBen <syben@users.noreply.github.com>
Date: 2015-09-14T09:49:11Z

CAMEL-9130 : added dependency to Jedis client

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/camel/pull/611

Tested from 2.7.0 to 2.7.3, got the following stack trace :


Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: redis.clients.jedis.JedisShardInfo.setTimeout(I)V
